key_events.description: Monthly dividend of BRL 0.8800 per share announced for January 2026, payable on January 15, 2026, with an ex-date of January 02, 2026.
XP reiterates a buy recommendation based on efficient management, low-risk credit portfolio, attractive trading price (VM/VP of 0.88x), and a yield estimated at 13.3% for the next 12 months.
XPCI11 quote started the year trading at R$82.91 and is now at R$85.89.

risk_factors: Higher market share volatility compared to peers.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Efficient management, low-risk credit portfolio, attractive trading price (VM/VP of 0.88x), and a yield estimated at 13.3% for the next 12 months support a buy recommendation. The fund also has R$ 0.87 per share of accumulated monetary correction reserve.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Lower liquidity and higher market share volatility compared to peers pose risks. No specific data on physical or financial vacancy rates or cap rate was found.

summary_markdown: XPCI11 announced a January 2026 dividend of BRL 0.8800 per share. The current dividend yield is around 12.28% - 12.57%. XP reiterates a buy recommendation based on an attractive trading price (VM/VP of 0.88x) and a yield estimated at 13.3% for the next 12 months. The fund distributed R$ 0.90 per share in November 2025. The fund has R$ 0.87 per share of accumulated monetary correction reserve. The XPCI11 quote started the year trading at R$82.91 and is now at R$85.89. P/VP (price over equity) is 0.96. The equity value per quota is R$ 89.26.
